description: From Latin catēnātus (“chained”), from catēnāre, from catēna (“chain”).

entries.meaning: Having the ability to catenate, or form chains.
examples: In this section we shall investigate some of the basic properties of D0L systems that generate locally catenative sequences. These locally catenative D0L systems form one of the mathematically most natural subclasses of the class of D0L systems.
Unlike periphrastics, however, catenatives combine certain verbs (e.g., impersonal δεῖ) with an infinitive.
